meanings.definition: The quality or state of being dull or lacking in brightness or sharpness.
meanings.sent1: The dulness of the old painting made it hard to see the details.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with dulness as the dim light barely illuminated the space.
meanings.sent3: The dulness of the lecture put the students to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a fog of dulness, unable to grasp even the simplest concepts.
meanings.sent5: The dulness of the blade made it impossible to cut through the tough meat.

meanings.definition: A feeling of boredom or lack of interest.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the dulness that settled in during the long meeting.
meanings.sent2: The dulness of the movie made her yawn repeatedly.
meanings.sent3: To combat the dulness, they decided to play a game to pass the time.
meanings.sent4: The dulness of the book left her searching for something more engaging to read.
meanings.sent5: The dulness of the conversation made her wish she was somewhere else.

meanings.definition: A lack of intelligence or quickness of mind.
meanings.sent1: His dulness in understanding the instructions led to repeated mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The dulness of his responses indicated a lack of comprehension.
meanings.sent3: Despite his dulness in math, he excelled in creative subjects.
meanings.sent4: The dulness of his wit made it hard for him to keep up with the jokes.
meanings.sent5: Her dulness in solving puzzles contrasted with her skill in painting.
